meanings.definition: Resembling a crown in shape or appearance.
meanings.sent1: The princess wore a coronoid tiara on her head.
meanings.sent2: The artist painted a coronoid design on the royal portrait.
meanings.sent3: The birthday cake was decorated with a coronoid pattern of colorful gems.
meanings.sent4: The sunset cast a coronoid glow over the horizon.
meanings.sent5: The garden was filled with coronoid flowers, each petal shining like a tiny crown.

meanings.definition: A bony projection on the upper part of the ulna.
meanings.sent1: The doctor pointed to the coronoid on the X-ray of the patient's arm.
meanings.sent2: The coronoid helps in the movement of the forearm.
meanings.sent3: The coronoid was so small that it looked like a tiny bone crown.
meanings.sent4: The coronoid acted as a protective shield for the elbow joint.
meanings.sent5: The coronoid felt smooth to the touch, like a small bump on the bone.
